name: multisyllabic
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having several syllables (= parts into which a word can be separated, usually containing a vowel), or using words like this: Forty percent of the multisyllabic words were stressed on the penultimate syllable. Arabic is a multi-syllabic language. Compare
monosyllabic (WORD) specialized
More examplesFewer examplesThey found that older adults were more likely than their younger counterparts to use longer or multisyllabic words. This measure indicates how often a child produced a multisyllabic form.This factor has not been examined in children’s repetition of multi-syllabic nonwords.
